poem:
The Desert's Reach  

In the sun's shadow,  
billions flow  
—electric oases bloom—  
green dreams whisper;  
yet, beneath the golden twine,  
the worker's song falters,  
and the earth,  
in its ancient tongue,  
murmurs gentle caution.  
Sand and seed entwined,  
treading softly,  
the future's pulse  
beats uncertainly.
